hypothesis_content.title: Multi-Timeframe Support/Resistance Break Failure
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC breaks a key technical level (daily pivot + weekly S/R confluence) on low conviction (volume < 80% of 20-day avg, < 3 consecutive 4H closes beyond level), it reverses to the prior range within 12 hours with > 72% probability in NEUTRAL regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In neutral regimes without strong directional catalysts, technical breaks often fail due to lack of follow-through. Low volume indicates absence of institutional participation, making such breaks vulnerable to reversal.
entry_conditions: BTC breaks daily pivot + weekly S/R level (within 0.3%)
Break volume < 80% of 20-day average for that hour
Less than 3 consecutive 4-hour closes beyond level
1-hour Stochastic (14,3,3) > 80 for breakdowns or < 20 for breakouts

exit_conditions.take_profit: Return to midpoint between broken level and prior swing high/low
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price achieves 3 consecutive 4-hour closes beyond level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Failed breaks (reversals) occur < 60% of time OR average gain < 0.5% after accounting for whipsaw losses.
